petershams in the uk stock wire and joining ferrules and will post internationally the wire should be cut using wire cutters the pliers are used to crimp the ferrules around ends of the wire to join them the superglue can be used to give added strength to the join millinery wire 0 9mm https //www petershams com/collections/millinery- wire/products/sprung-millinery-wire-3-yards ferrules https //www petershams com/collections/millinery-wire/products/silver-wire-joining- ferrules-for-sprung-millinery-hat-wire-10-pieces crochet over the millinery wire until close to a full circle is made cut the wire to size undo a little of the crochet to give room to work join the ends of the wire with the ferrule by crimping it over the ends of the wire ferrules can sometimes allow the wire to slip out after crimping and extra grip can be achieved by applying superglue inside the ferrule and 1 | page around the join the wire when joined should stretch the crochet out but not to the point that it distorts the hat allow the glue to dry and then continue to crochet over the joined wire instructions this pattern is worked in spirals do not turn at the end of each round start crocheting directly
